abstract: Barnes & Noble started a round of e-reader price-cutting by dropping the price of the original Nook.
snippet: Barnes & Noble started a round of e-reader price-cutting by dropping the price of the original Nook.
lead_paragraph: On our sister blog, Bits, Brad Stone reports that on Monday, Barnes & Noble started a round of e-reader price-cutting by dropping the price of the original Nook, with Wi-Fi and 3G wireless connectivity, to $199 from $259. It also introduced a new, Wi-Fi-only Nook at $149. That compares to the Amazon Kindle at $259 and the Sony Reader, whose least expensive version, the Pocket Edition, costs $169 and has no wireless connectivity at all.

abstract: Reacting to a price cut for the Barnes & Noble Nook, Amazon has dropped the price for the Kindle to $189.
snippet: Reacting to a price cut for the Barnes & Noble Nook, Amazon has dropped the price for the Kindle to $189.

abstract: Barnes & Noble said it would drop the price of the Nook to $199. Responding rapidly, Amazon.com cut the price of its popular Kindle e-reader below the Nook, to $189.
snippet: Barnes & Noble said it would drop the price of the Nook to $199. Responding rapidly, Amazon.com cut the price of its popular Kindle e-reader below the Nook, to $189.
lead_paragraph: A price war is brewing in the growing market for electronic reading devices.

headline.main: In Price War, E-Readers Go Below $200
headline.print_headline: In Price War, E-Readers Go Below $200
